column3: Description
A Gummi that makes certain Pokemon drool in delight. Fills your belly by 5; 10; 15; 20; or 25; and increases your IQ by 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5 depending on your type. Dark types love these!
A Gummi that makes certain Pokemon drool in delight. Fills your belly by 5; 10; 15; 20; or 25; and increases your IQ by 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5 depending on your type. Water types love these!
A Gummi that makes certain Pokemon drool in delight. Fills your belly by 5; 10; 15; 20; or 25; and increases your IQ by 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5 depending on your type. Ground types love these!

A Gummi that makes certain Pokemon drool in delight. Fills your belly by 5; 10; 15; 20; or 25; and increases your IQ by 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5 depending on your type. Electric types love these!
A Gummi that makes certain Pokemon drool in delight. Fills your belly by 5; 10; 15; 20; or 25; and increases your IQ by 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5 depending on your type. Fairy types love these!
It has a curious texture unlike any other Gummi, never has the same taste twice... it's always delicious! Fills your belly by 25 and increases your IQ by 5, regardless of your type.
A Lookalike Item for Wonder Gummi, so be careful! Eating it will make you dizzy and wander randomly, giving you the Blinker status.
Absolute perfection in Gummi form. Don't look at it too long... Fills your belly by 50 and increases your IQ by 15, regardless of your type.
A very tiny Apple. Fills your belly by 25; or temporarily increases Belly Size by 1 if already full.
A juicy Apple. Fills your belly by 50; or temporarily increases Belly Size by 5 if already full.
Lookalike item for an Apple. Attempting to eat it will make the Bapple Bap you, making you Flinch! Then it will run away.
A very fresh Big Apple! Fills your belly by 100; or temporarily increases Belly Size by 10 if already full.
An Apple so big it takes 2 turns to eat! Fills your belly by 150; or temporarily increases Belly Size by 15 if already full!
Also known as Sekai Ichi. A pink Apple far too delicious for feeble minds to comprehend. Fills your belly by 200; or temporarily increases Belly Size by 20 if already full!

It's one of the Golden Items. A Perfect Apple coated in a golden glow; far too precious and beautiful to even consider eating! It completely fills your Belly AND increases your maximum Belly Size by 50!
A rare; healthy Banana. Fills your belly by 50. Temporarily increases Belly Size by 10 if already full. Also has a 10% chance to raise your level by 1...
It's one of the Golden Items. A mysterious Banana coated in a golden glow. So healthy... Fills your belly by 50. Temporarily increases Belly Size by 10 if already full; and increases your level by 5!
A Chestnut to peel open. Fills your belly by 50, but deals you 1 damage. Temporarily increases Belly Size by 5 if already full. Mankeys and Primeapes get +1 to all stats when eating this!
A little diet Donut. Fills your belly by 25; or temporarily increases Belly Size by 1 if already full; and randomly; permanently increases one of your stats by 1.
A sugary Donut. Fills your belly by 50; or temporarily increases Belly Size by 1 if already full; and randomly; permanently increases one of your stats by 1... twice.
A thick; round Donut! Fills your belly by 100; or temporarily increases Belly Size by 1 if already full; and randomly; permanently increases one of your stats by 1... thrice!

A fortune cookie. Fills your belly by 25; or temporarily increases Belly Size by 1 if already full; and randomly; permanently increases one of your stats by 1... a random number of times between 1 and 4!
Just objectively the best thing ever. Fills your belly by 25; or temporarily increases Belly Size by 1 if already full. Permanently increases all your stats by 1!
Yuck. Fills your belly by 25; or temporarily increases Belly Size by 1 if already full. But you will get a random bad status condition!
Lookalike item for Grimy Food. Eating this will turn you Ghost type and allows you to walk through walls!
When thrown; it flies high in an arc to clear obstacles and strike the target for 10 damage. It is not affected by Pierce or Long Toss and can be thrown at any angle.
A Lookalike Item for Geo Pebble. This item has a nostalgic feel and causes the user to bring to mind a dearly held memory... tears begin to well up, and the user sobs and switches to Enduring status!
When thrown; it flies high in an arc to clear obstacles and strike the target for 20 damage. It is not affected by Pierce or Long Toss and can be thrown at any angle.
It is a Lookalike Item for Gravelerock. When eaten by a Bonsly or Sudowoodo, increases IQ by 10.
When thrown; it flies high in an arc to clear obstacles and strike the target for 50 damage! It is not affected by Pierce or Long Toss and can be thrown at any angle.
It is a Lookalike Item for Golestone. It has silly puns carved on it. When used, it makes everyone in the room cringe and afflicted by the Flinching status. Even teammates!
When thrown; it flies high in an arc to clear obstacles and strike the target for 10 damage; and a 10% confusion chance. It is not affected by Pierce or Long Toss and can be thrown at any angle.
When thrown; it flies high in an arc to clear obstacles and strike the target for 100 damage! It is not affected by Pierce or Long Toss and can be thrown at any angle.

It's one of the Golden Items. A fossil somehow coated in a golden glow. When thrown; it flies high in an arc to clear obstacles and strike the target for 50 damage; and it never breaks! It is not affected by Pierce or Long Toss and can be thrown at any angle.
An odd stone similar to an Unown; shaped like the letter A. When thrown; it flies in a straight line and damage with an attack power of 50.
An odd stone similar to an Unown; shaped like the letter B. When thrown; it flies in a straight line and damage with an attack power of 50.
An odd stone similar to an Unown; shaped like the letter C. When thrown; it flies in a straight line and damage with an attack power of 50.
An odd stone similar to an Unown; shaped like the letter D. When thrown; it flies in a straight line and damage with an attack power of 50.
An odd stone similar to an Unown; shaped like the letter E. When thrown; it flies in a straight line and damage with an attack power of 50.
An odd stone similar to an Unown; shaped like the letter F. When thrown; it flies in a straight line and damage with an attack power of 50.
An odd stone similar to an Unown; shaped like the letter G. When thrown; it flies in a straight line and damage with an attack power of 50.
An odd stone similar to an Unown; shaped like the letter H. When thrown; it flies in a straight line and damage with an attack power of 50.

An odd stone similar to an Unown; shaped like the letter J. When thrown; it flies in a straight line and damage with an attack power of 50.
An odd stone similar to an Unown; shaped like the letter K. When thrown; it flies in a straight line and damage with an attack power of 50.
An odd stone similar to an Unown; shaped like the letter L. When thrown; it flies in a straight line and damage with an attack power of 50.
An odd stone similar to an Unown; shaped like the letter M. When thrown; it flies in a straight line and damage with an attack power of 50.
An odd stone similar to an Unown; shaped like the letter N. When thrown; it flies in a straight line and damage with an attack power of 50.
An odd stone similar to an Unown; shaped like the letter O. When thrown; it flies in a straight line and damage with an attack power of 50.
An odd stone similar to an Unown; shaped like the letter P. When thrown; it flies in a straight line and damage with an attack power of 50.
An odd stone similar to an Unown; shaped like the letter Q. When thrown; it flies in a straight line and damage with an attack power of 50.
An odd stone similar to an Unown; shaped like the letter R. When thrown; it flies in a straight line and damage with an attack power of 50.
An odd stone similar to an Unown; shaped like the letter S. When thrown; it flies in a straight line and damage with an attack power of 50.
An odd stone similar to an Unown; shaped like the letter T. When thrown; it flies in a straight line and damage with an attack power of 50.
An odd stone similar to an Unown; shaped like the letter U. When thrown; it flies in a straight line and damage with an attack power of 50.
An odd stone similar to an Unown; shaped like the letter V. When thrown; it flies in a straight line and damage with an attack power of 50.
An odd stone similar to an Unown; shaped like the letter W. When thrown; it flies in a straight line and damage with an attack power of 50.
An odd stone similar to an Unown; shaped like the letter X. When thrown; it flies in a straight line and damage with an attack power of 50.
An odd stone similar to an Unown; shaped like the letter Y. When thrown; it flies in a straight line and damage with an attack power of 50.
An odd stone similar to an Unown; shaped like the letter Z. When thrown; it flies in a straight line and damage with an attack power of 50.
An odd stone similar to an Unown; shaped like the letter !. When thrown; it flies in a straight line and damage with an attack power of 100!
An odd stone similar to an Unown; shaped like the letter ?. When thrown; it flies in a straight line and damage with an attack power of 50; and deal a random status condition!
When thrown; it flies in a straight line and deals damage with an attack power of 10.
When thrown; it flies in a straight line and deals damage with an attack power of 15.
When thrown; it flies in a straight line and deals damage with an attack power of 20.

A Wooden Stick; Thorn; or Spike that's been hit by a Grass Type move. It has sharp leaves. When thrown; flies in a straight line and deals damage with an attack power of 10; and hits nearby foes as well.
A Wooden Stick; Thorn; or Spike that's been hit by a Fire Type move. It has embers flying off. When thrown; flies in a straight line and deals damage with an attack power of 10; and inflicts a burn.

A Wooden Stick; Thorn; or Spike that's been hit by a Water Type move. It has a whirlpool around it. When thrown; flies in a straight line and deals damage with an attack power of 10; and sends flying.
When thrown; it flies in a straight line and deals damage with an attack power of 30.
When thrown; it flies in a straight line and deals damage with an attack power of 40.
When thrown; it flies in a straight line and deals damage with an attack power of 50.
A pointy twig. When thrown; flies in a straight line and deals damage with an attack power of 20; and a 30% flinch chance.
A spiky spike. When thrown; flies in a straight line and deals damage with an attack power of 20; and a 60% flinch chance.
A glossy fang. When thrown; flies in a straight line and deals damage with an attack power of 20; and causes flinching.
A mysterious; brightly glowing spike. When thrown; flies in a straight line and deals damage with an attack power of 100!
A sharp arrow. When thrown; flies in a straight line and deals damage with an attack power of 20; and never misses.
A spike crafted from bronze. When thrown; flies in a straight line and deals damage with an attack power of 30; and never breaks!
A rare spike crafted from pure silver. When thrown; flies in a straight line and deals damage with an attack power of 40; and never breaks!
It's one of the Golden Items. A brilliantly shining spike crafted from solid; glowing gold. When thrown; flies in a straight line and deals damage with an attack power of 50; and never breaks!
A dressy fashion accessory. It evolves Feebas into Milotic.
A rock that radiates a peculiar energy, rumored only to exist on Mt. Coronet, a place that no one knows anything about. Evolves Magneton and Nosepass into Magnezone and Probopass respectively.
A stone that radiates deep chill, so it is easily mistaken for a chunk of ice. Evolves Eevee into Glaceon.
An intriguing cable used for linking unknown devices... Evolves Kadabra, Machoke, Graveler, Haunter, Boldore, and Gurdurr into Alakazam, Machamp, Golem, Gengar, Gigalith, and Conkeldurr respectively.
A ribbon filled with heartwarming moonlight energy. Evolves Eevee, Gligar, Sneasel, and Chingling into Umbreon, Gliscor, Weavile, and Chimecho respectively.
A stone covered in lush moss that exudes the vitality of plants. It evolves Eevee into Leafeon.
A ribbon infused with heartwarming sunshine energy. It evolves Eevee, Budew, Happiny, and Riolu into Espeon, Roselia, Chansey, and Lucario respectively.
A pretty scale that shines faintly. It evolves Clamperl into Gorebyss.
A supersharp fang with a subtle gleam. It evolves Clamperl into Huntail.
A thick, tough, hydrodynamic scale. It evolves Seadra into Kingdra.
An enigmatic disc that overflows with dubious data... It evolves Porygon2 into Porygon-Z.
An odd stone with a mesmerizing darkness. It evolves Murkrow, Misdreavus, and Lampent into Honchkrow, Mismagius, and Chandelure respectively.
A box full of a massive amount of electric energy. It evolves Electabuzz into Electivire.
A peculiar orange stone that radiates warmth like a flame. It evolves Vulpix, Growlithe, Eevee, and Pansear into Ninetales, Arcanine, Flareon, and Simisear respectively.
Lookalike item for the Fire Stone. Attempting to use it will cause a stone fanatic Charizard to drop on you and fight you for it!
An impressive, rocky crown that conveys a kingly nobility. It evolves Poliwhirl and Slowpoke into Politoed and Slowking respectively.
A peculiar stone inscribed with a leafy pattern. It evolves Gloom, Weepinbell, Exeggcute, Nuzleaf, and Pansage into Vileplume, Victreebel, Exeggutor, Shiftry, and Simisage respectively.
A box brimming with a huge amount of magma energy. It evolves Magmar into Magmortar.
A misterious substance full of a special filmy metal. It evolves Onix and Scyther into Steelix and Scizor respectively.

An odd stone that gleams like the moon in the evening sky. It evolves Nidorina, Nidorino, Clefairy, Jigglypuff, Skitty, and Munna into Nidoqueen, Nidoking, Clefable, Wigglytuff, Delcatty, and Musharna respectively.
A surprisingly smooth, round, egg shaped stone. It evolves Happiny into Chansey.
A heavy, durable piece of protective equipment. It evolves Rhydon into Rhyperior.
A wickedly sharp claw perfect for raking foes. It evolves Sneasel into Weavile.
A savagely sharp, piercing fang. It evolves Gligar into Gliscor.
An eerie cloth imbued with horrifyingly strong spiritual energy. It evolves Dusclops into Dusknoir.
An odd stone that shines with dazzling light. It evolves Togetic, Roselia, and Minccino into Togekiss, Roserade and Cinccino.
An odd stone that glows with sunny warmth. It evolves Gloom, Sunkern, Cottonee, and Petilil into Bellossom, Sunflora, Whimsicott, and Lilligant.
A peculiar stone with a thunderbolt pattern, gives a zap everytime you grab it. It evolves Pikachu and Eevee into Raichu and Jolteon.
A mysterious device filled with all sorts of important updates. It evolves Porygon into Porygon2.

A peculiar stone that holds the color of clearest blue. It evolves Poliwhirl, Shellder, Staryu, Eevee, Lombre, and Panpour into Poliwrath, Cloyster, Starmie, Vaporeon, Ludicolo, and Simipour respectively.
Raises the power of nearby teammates' moves by 10%, but not the holder's.
Protects teammates from being confused, but not the holder.
Protects teammates from being poisoned, but not the holder.
Protects teammates from sleeping, but not the holder.
Protects teammates from being paralyzed, but not the holder.
Protects teammates from stat drops, but not the holder.
Allows teammates to survive a move that would KO them with 1 HP, but not the holder.
May contain a rare item, but only if gifted to a Bug type connection.
May contain a rare item, but only if gifted to a Dark type connection.
May contain a rare item, but only if gifted to a Dragon type connection.
May contain a rare item, but only if gifted to an Electric type connection.
May contain a rare item, but only if gifted to a Fighting type connection.
May contain a rare item, but only if gifted to a Fire type connection.
May contain a rare item, but only if gifted to a Flying type connection.
May contain a rare item, but only if gifted to a Ghost type connection.
May contain a rare item, but only if gifted to a Grass type connection.
May contain a rare item, but only if gifted to a Ground type connection.
May contain a rare item, but only if gifted to an Ice type connection.
May contain a rare item, but only if gifted to a Normal type connection.
May contain a rare item, but only if gifted to a Poison type connection.
May contain a rare item, but only if gifted to a Psychic type connection.
May contain a rare item, but only if gifted to a Rock type connection.
May contain a rare item, but only if gifted to a Steel type connection.
May contain a rare item, but only if gifted to a Water type connection.
May contain a rare item, but only if gifted to a Fairy type connection.
May contain an exceptionally rare item, but only if gifted to a Legendary or Mythical connection!
May contain an exceptionally rare item, but only if shipped to a connection from the Shaymin Village!
A healthy vitamin that fills your belly by 5 and permanently raises Attack by 1.
An experimental vitamin... it fills your belly by 5 and permanently raises Attack by 3, but will decrease Max HP by 1!
A healthy vitamin that fills your belly by 5 and permanently raises Defense by 1.
An experimental vitamin... it fills your belly by 5 and permanently raises Defense by 3, but will decrease Max HP by 1!
A healthy vitamin that fills your belly by 5 and permanently raises Special Attack by 1.
An experimental vitamin... it fills your belly by 5 and permanently raises Special Attack by 3, but will decrease Max HP by 1!
A healthy vitamin that fills your belly by 5 and permanently raises Special Defense by 1.
An experimental vitamin... it fills your belly by 5 and permanently raises Special Defense by 3, but will decrease Max HP by 1!
A healthy vitamin that fills your belly by 5 and permanently raises Speed by 1.
An experimental vitamin... it fills your belly by 5 and permanently raises Speed by 3, but will decrease Max HP by 1!
A reinvigorating coffee that increases a move's level by 1. Also fills your belly by 5.
A refreshing drink that restores one of your moves' PP by 10 and fills your belly by 5.
A refreshing drink that fully restores one of your moves' PP and fills your belly by 5.
A refreshing drink that restores all of your moves' PP by 10 and fills your belly by 5.
A refreshing drink that fully restores all of your moves' PP and fills your belly by 5.
It is a Lookalike Item for the Max Elixir. A drink that restores the PP of all moves, but only for Linoone. Fills your belly by 5.
A supersweet nectar that restores all of your moves' PP by 10 and fills your belly by 10.
A beautiful and elegant scarf. It has no effect even if you hold it, but you can sell it at a shop for a high price.
A mysterious key that will open a white door. It disappears after use...
A lookalike item for a White Key. The key will whine and complain if you try to use it without a Klefki in your team...
A mysterious key that will open a black door. It disappears after use...
A mysterious key that will open a blue door. It disappears after use...
A mysterious key that will open a green door. It disappears after use...
A mysterious key that will open a red door. It disappears after use...

One of the Seven Secret Treasures. A remarkable harmonica that plays melodies serene as flowing water, rumored to steal watery hearts. When held by the team leader, this item makes it easier to recruit defeated Water-type Pokémon to the team.

One of the Seven Secret Treasures. An exotic drum that beats out rhythms that burn with fiery passion, rumored to steal fiery hearts. When held by the team leader, it is easier to recruit defeated Fire-type Pokémon to the team.

One of the Seven Secret Treasures. A festive cornet that is well suited for tunes that carry across grassy fields, rumored to steal hearts of grass. When held by the team leader, it is easier to recruit defeated Grass-type Pokémon to the team.

One of the Seven Secret Treasures. An unusual flute that plays notes that are clear as ice, rumored to steal even the iciest of hearts. When held by the team leader, it is easier to recruit defeated Ice-type Pokémon to the team.

One of the Seven Secret Treasures. A mystifying horn that blasts sound at rock-shattering volume, rumored to steal the rockiest of hearts. When held by the team leader, it is easier to recruit defeated Rock-type Pokémon to the team.

One of the Seven Secret Treasures. A merry melodica that plays tunes airy as cloudless skies, rumored to steal flighty hearts. When held by the team leader, it is easier to recruit defeated Flying-type Pokémon to the team.

One of the Seven Secret Treasures. A marvelous cymbal with a colossal crash that shakes the ground, rumored to steal even the most grounded hearts. When held by the team leader, it is easier to recruit defeated Ground-type Pokémon to the team.
A box that is amazingly adorable. It likely contains something but won't give up its secrets easily.
A box that is dainty and fashionable. It likely contains something but won't give up its secrets easily.
A box that is extravagant and opulent. It likely contains something but won't give up its secrets easily.
A box that glitters with dazzling light. It likely contains something but won't give up its secrets easily.
A box that's beautiful beyond measure. It likely contains something but won't give up its secrets easily.
A box that is impenetrably hard. It likely contains something but won't give up its secrets easily.
A box that is unbelievably heavy. It likely contains something but won't give up its secrets easily.
A box that is surprisingly light. It likely contains something but won't give up its secrets easily.
A box that is completely impressive. It likely contains something but won't give up its secrets easily.
A box that is startlingly pretty. It likely contains something but won't give up its secrets easily.
A box that sparkles and shines. It likely contains something but won't give up its secrets easily.
A box that is suspiciously sinister. It likely contains something but won't give up its secrets easily.
It's proof that you obtained all of the Ancient Treasures. But it seems to have no particular effect, even if you take it on your adventure.
It's proof that you obtained all of the items invented by the Never Hungries. But it seems to have no particular effect, even if you take it on your adventure.
It's proof that you obtained all of the Eight Treasures, but it seems to have no particular effect, even if you take it on your adventure.
It's proof that you obtained all of the Golden Items. But it seems to have no particular effect, even if you take it on your adventure.
It's proof that you obtained all of the Crowns. But it seems to have no particular effect, even if you take it on your adventure.
It has seven notches. It's one of the Eight Treasures that only the strong are said to be able to obtain. It's said to prevent a Mega-Evolved Pokémon from going berserk if the Pokémon holds it.
It has three notches. It prevents enemy Pokémon's moves from resulting in a critical hit. You can add various effects by setting emeras on it.
It has three notches. It prevents carried items from getting sticky as a result of traps or other means. You can add various effects by setting emeras on it.
It has four notches. It prevents the holder from getting poisoned or badly poisoned. You can add various effects by setting emeras on it.
It has four notches. It prevents the holder from getting confused. You can add various effects by setting emeras on it.
It has four notches. It prevents all of the holder's stats from being lowered. You can add various effects by setting emeras on it.
It has four notches. It protects the holder from Sleep, Yawning, Napping, or having Nightmares. You can add various effects by setting emeras on it.
It has four notches. The holder is completely unaffected by weather!
It has one notch. It's one of the Eight Treasures that only the strong are said to be able to obtain. It prevents the holder from having bad status conditions or a reduction in stats.
It has four notches. It boosts the holder's Attack by 10. You can add various effects by setting emeras on it.
It has five notches. It's one of the Ancient Treasures. It's said to have the effect of boosting Max HP by 50.
It has four notches. It boosts the critical-hit rate if the holder uses the same move it used the turn before. You can add various effects by setting emeras on it.
It has five notches. It's one of the Ancient Treasures. It's said to boost Attack and Special Attack by 20.
It has four notches. It boosts the holder's Defense by 10. You can add various effects by setting emeras on it.
It has four notches. Lookalike Item for Defense Looplet. Equipping this will cause all your moves to do no damage to Bug types!
It has four notches. It boosts the holder's evasiveness. You can add various effects by setting emeras on it.
It has four notches. It boosts the critical-hit rate if the holder uses a move it didn't use the turn before. You can add various effects by setting emeras on it.
It has three notches. It boosts the holder's critical-hit rate for moves. You can add various effects by setting emeras on it.
It has five notches. It's one of the Ancient Treasures. It's said to boost Defense by 50. You can add various effects by setting emeras on it.
It has five notches. It's one of the Ancient Treasures. It's said to have the effect of boosting Defense and Sp. Def by 20.
It has three notches. It's one of the Eight Treasures that only the strong are said to be able to obtain. It is said to boost the power of moves significantly.
It has five notches. It's one of the Ancient Treasures. It's said to boost the Speed of the holder by 50.
It has four notches. Increases the Special Attack of the holder by 10.
It has four notches. Increases the Special Defense of the holder by 10.
It has three notches. Increases the Speed of the holder by 20.
It has five notches. It's one of the Ancient Treasures. It's said to boost the Special Attack of the holder by 30.
It has five notches. It's one of the Ancient Treasures. It's said to boost the Special Defense of the holder by 40.
It has five notches. It's one of the Ancient Treasures. It's said to boost the Attack of the holder by 30.
It has five notches. It enables the holder to participate in an Alliance even when the holder is far away from the leader. You can add various effects by setting emeras on it.

It has three notches. It's one of the items invented by the legendary glutton team, the Never Hungries. You'll definitely want it for your adventure! The holder gets hungry half as much, even if it walks or uses an Alliance.
It has four notches. When a teammate with low HP is nearby, the holder receives the attack instead.
It has four notches. It enables the holder to shrug off moves and pass them on to a nearby Pokémon. But the holder's Belly gets emptier every time it happens.
It has two notches. It's one of the Eight Treasures that only the strong are said to be able to obtain. It makes the holder immune to traps.
It has four notches. If the leader holds it, items buried in the ground shine visibly.
It has six notches. It sometimes explodes when the holder takes damage. It damages nearby Pokémon and makes items on the floor disappear.
It has four notches. It does nothing, but it can be sold for a high price!
It has three notches. It's one of the Eight Treasures that only the strong are said to be able to obtain. It makes all traps on the floor visible to the holder.
It has three notches. Doubles the passive HP regeneration when walking.

It has five notches. It's one of the items invented by the legendary glutton team, the Never Hungries. You'll definitely want it for your adventure! Holding it is said to prevent you from getting hungry during an Alliance.
It has one notch. The holder gains 1 experience point each turn, even when not battling.
It has one notch. Lookalike item for Joy Looplet. Equipping this will make you look like a Male, regardless of you gender!?
It has three nothces. It's an ordinary looplet. Holding it has no effect, but you can add various effects by setting emeras on it.
It has one notch. It's one of the Eight Treasures that only the strong are said to be able to obtain. It's said the holder has a 50% chance to not consume PP's when using a move.
It has ten notches. It prevents the holder's Ability from working.
It has five notches. Picking up Poke' from the ground heals all status conditions.

It has two notches. It's one of the items invented by the legendary glutton team, the Never Hungries. You definitely want it for your adventure. Holding it is said prevents you from getting hungry by walking.

It has two notches. It's one of the Eight Treasures that only the strong are said to be able to obtain. It's said to reveal the locations of items and enemies on the entire floor if the leader holds it.
It has two notches. It warps the holder near it's teammates if they end up alone.
It has four notches. Has a 10% chance to warp the holder to a random room at the end of their turn.

It has two notches. It's one of the Eight Treasures that only the strong are said to be able to obtain. It's said to make the holder's thrown items pierce through all Pokémon and walls and fly endlessly.
It has four notches. It's one of the items invented by the legendary glutton team, the Never Hungries. You'll want it for your adventure! The holder gets twice as full as usual from eating.
Waving it at a Pokémon causes a blast that deals 30 damage. It damages nearby Pokémon, too.
Waving it at a Pokémon makes that Pokémon confused.
Waving it reveals the way to the stairs.
Waving at a Pokémon swaps the HP of you and that Pokémon.
Waving it at a Pokémon makes that Pokémon petrified.
Waving it at a Pokémon or a wall makes you jump right at it.
Waving at a Pokémon cuts that Pokémon's HP to 1/4.
Lookalike Item for Quarter Wand. Waving it inside a dungeon Kecleon Shop will give you a 10% discount on everything!
Waving it at a Pokémon reduces that Pokémon's Travel Speed for a while.
Waving it at a Pokémon makes that Pokémon sleep.
Warps a Pokémon to the stairs and makes it petrified.
Waving it at a Pokémon warps all teammates to that Pokémon.
Waving it at a Pokémon makes you switch places with that Pokémon.
Waving it at a Pokémon changes that Pokémon's Ability to Truant.
If the wand targets a destructible wall, a straight line of up to 10 wall tiles are turned into floor tiles. If there are Pokemon in the way, it deals them 10 damage.
Waving it at a Pokémon reduces that Pokémon's HP to 1, but the same will happen to you!
Waving it at a Pokémon warps that Pokémon somewhere on the floor.
Waving it at a Pokémon knocks that Pokémon flying. The Pokémon takes damage if it hits a wall or another Pokémon.
Eating it causes all Pokemon on the floor to have the user's last move disabled.
Eating it makes you attack 1 tile in front of you with a blast, causing 100 damage!
Throwing it at a Pokemon gives them the Blinker status.
Eating it turns you into a Decoy, causing all moves and items to target you instead of your teammates.
Throwing it at a Pokemon lowers their level by 1. Don't miss because they can do the same to you!
It is a Lookalike Item for the Doom Seed, but this is one mistake you'll be very happy to make! Eating it makes more Poké appear on the next floor.
Eating it gives you the Encouraged status.
Eating it fully restores your HP, and temporarily increases your Max HP by 10!
Eating it cures the Blinker status and gives you the Eyedrops status.
It is a Lookalike Item for the Eyedrop Seed. A food item that gives the Dropeye status, where the immediate surrounding area will be dark, even in rooms.
A Plain Seed... but unlike other Plain Seeds, it's very sought after for some reason.
It's one of the Golden Items, with a golden glow. They say eating it boosts your level by 3.
A healthy seed, eating it removes any and all status conditions.
Eating it depletes your Belly by 10... there must be a use case for this.
A delicious seed that increases your level by 1.
A healthy seed that increases your Max HP by 1.
Eating it has no particular effect. It's really an ordinary seed.
Eating it warps you close to the floor's stairs.
Eating it boosts your Travel Speed for a little while.
Eating it has no particular effect, but if a Pokemon faints with one, it revives them with 1 HP, then turns into a Plain Seed.
Eating it has no particular effect, but if a Pokemon faints with one, it revives them with fully restored HP and heals all status conditions, then turns into a Plain Seed.
It is a Lookalike Item for the Reviver Seed. But what does it do when you faint...?
Eating it has no particular effect, but if a Pokemon faints with one, it revives them with fully restored HP, PP, and Belly, and heals all status conditions, then turns into a Plain Seed.
Throwing it at a Pokemon puts them to Sleep.
It is a Lookalike Item for the Sleep Seed, but you'll be pleasantly surprised when you make a mistake on this one! Eating it gives the Slip status, where it is possible to walk on water.
Eating it resets Attack, Sp. Atk, Defense, Sp. Def, accuracy, and evasiveness.
Throwing it at a Pokemon causes them to be Petrified.
Throwing it at a Pokemon causes them to be Confused.
Eating it gives you the Training condition, which boosts the growth of moves.
Eating it gives you the Invisible condition.
A mysterious seed, imbued with shadow energy... eating it raises your Attack and Special Attack to the absolute maximum!
Eating it lowers your Defense and Special Defense by 1 level.
It is a Lookalike Item for the Vile Seed. Eating it causes you to say ''See Ya!'' and warp to a random room!
Eating it warps you to a different place on the floor.
Throwing it at a Pokemon gives them the Cross Eyed status.
A held item that prevents the Pokémon's items from getting sticky and gunked up by a trap.
Lookalike item for the No-Stick cap. Occasionally, items in your Treasure Bag will become sticky.
A held item that prevents a Poisoned or Badly Poisoned status from being inflicted on the Pokémon.
A held item that prevents the Pokémon from getting a Confused status.
A held item that shields the Pokémon from weather, as if it's always in Clear conditions.
A held item that boosts the Pokémon's Defense.
A held item that boosts the Pokémon's evasiveness.
A held item that boosts the Pokémon's Attack and Special Attack by 10 but also makes the Pokémon's Belly go down faster.
A held item that boosts the Pokémon's Attack.
A held item that boosts the Pokémon's Special Attack.
A held item that prevents the Pokémon's Attack and Special Attack from being reduced
A held item that boosts the Pokémon's Special Defense.
A held item that makes thrown items bounce straight back from the Pokémon.
It boosts the critical-hit rate if the holder uses the same move it used the turn before.
Lookalike Item for Choice Ribbon. Equipping this will make it disappear, a Primeape will appear in front of you, and you'll have to choose between giving him a Chestnut or battling!
When one of your teammates holds this, it's easier to use a Team Attack.
When a Pokémon with low HP is nearby, the holder takes damage instead.
A held item that makes thrown items bounce off walls and fly sideways along walls. It has no effect if the Pokémon has a Pierce status or if throws a rock.
A held item that changes the Pokémon's status to Hungry Pal, which empties its Belly faster and prevents it from being filled.
A held item that prevents any thrown item from hitting the Pokémon.
It boosts the critical-hit ratio if the holder uses a move it didn't use the turn before.
An item that has no effect even if held by a Pokémon. It can be sold for a good price.
A held item that speeds up the Pokémon's natural HP healing.
A held item that earns the Pokémon Experience equal to the damage taken.
The holder won't take a critical hit even when it's hit by moves of enemy Pokémon.
A held item that enables the Pokémon to move and attack through walls and move on inhospitable terrain, such as magma, in exchange for Belly.
A held item that causes the Pokémon to shrug off any effects from moves and pass them on to an adjacent Pokémon in exchange for Belly.
A held item that increases the Pokémon's chances of taking critical hits from enemy moves and attacks. There must be a use case for this...
A held item that makes the Pokémon's thrown items pierce through all targets, walls and obstacles without stopping. It has no effect on thrown rocks.
An item that has no effect even if held by a Pokémon.
A held item that helps awaken sleeping Pokémon enemies.
A mysterious scarf that allows Pokemon to remember any move, regardless of current level.
When the holder gets separated from you, it will warp near you. If the user holds it, they'll warp near their teammate when they get separated.
A held item that prevents the Pokémon from awakening sleeping enemies.
An item that has no effect even if held by a Pokémon. It can be sold for a great price!
A held item that slows how quickly the Pokémon's Belly goes down.
A held item that prevents the Belly from going down by standing still.
Lookalike item for Tight Belt. With this equipped, you can only move right!
A held item that prevents traps from activating when the Pokémon steps on them.
A held item that warps the Pokémon to another place on the floor every 10 turns.
A radiant, incredibly soft, glowing bow that if held long enough, will change color based on the holder's Aura.
Boosts the holder's Attack, Special Attack, Defense, and Special Defense by 1 level if the holder has a clear aqua blue Aura.
Boosts the holder's Attack, Special Attack, Defense, and Special Defense by 1 level if the holder has a subdued brown Aura.
Boosts the holder's Attack, Special Attack, Defense, and Special Defense by 1 level if the holder has a smart marine blue Aura.
Boosts the holder's Attack, Special Attack, Defense, and Special Defense by 1 level if the holder has a vivid pink Aura.
Boosts the holder's Attack, Special Attack, Defense, and Special Defense by 1 level if the holder has a refreshing green Aura.
Boosts the holder's Attack, Special Attack, Defense, and Special Defense by 1 level if the holder has a brilliant green Aura.
Boosts the holder's Attack, Special Attack, Defense, and Special Defense by 1 level if the holder has a gentle mint green Aura.
Boosts the holder's Attack, Special Attack, Defense, and Special Defense by 1 level if the holder has a stunning orange Aura.
Boosts the holder's Attack, Special Attack, Defense, and Special Defense by 1 level if the holder has an uplifting pink Aura.
Boosts the holder's Attack, Special Attack, Defense, and Special Defense by 1 level if the holder has a mystic purple Aura.
Boosts the holder's Attack, Special Attack, Defense, and Special Defense by 1 level if the holder has a fiery red Aura.
Boosts the holder's Attack, Special Attack, Defense, and Special Defense by 1 level if the holder has a stately silver Aura.
Boosts the holder's Attack, Special Attack, Defense, and Special Defense by 1 level if the holder has a cool sky blue Aura.
Boosts the holder's Attack, Special Attack, Defense, and Special Defense by 1 level if the holder has an elegant violet Aura.
Boosts the holder's Attack, Special Attack, Defense, and Special Defense by 1 level if the holder has a deep green Aura.
Boosts the holder's Attack, Special Attack, Defense, and Special Defense by 1 level if the holder has an energetic yellow Aura.
Antitheft specs that prevent the Pokémon from having its held item snatched away or swatted down.
High field of view specs that reveal hidden traps, Pokemon, and stairs to the holder.
Lookalike item for the Goggle Specs! A held item that makes the Pokémon stand out, making it easier to hit by enemies.
Golden scopes that scan for any hidden Gold Bars or Golden Items hidden in the floor.
Psychedelic glasses that prevent Sleep, Yawning, Napping, or having a Nightmare.
Specs with a built in HUD that makes thrown items never miss.
Lookalike of Lock-On Specs, with a defective HUD that makes thrown items fly in random directions!
Thermal lens that increases the holder's Crit chance by +1.
Modified Lock-On Specs that allow the holder to throw items without hitting anyone. There must be a use case for this...
Powerful, wall scanning specs that make all Pokemon and Items fully visible on the map, but not tiles or stairs.
A Lookalike item for the X-Ray Specs. Wearing these will turn off your map!
One of the Infinite Crowns. It proves that you overcame difficulties with your courageous bravery. Boosts the holder's Attack by 30!
One of the Infinite Crowns. It proves that you overcame difficulties with your continuous efforts. Boosts the holder's Defense by 30!
One of the Infinite Crowns. It proves that you overcame difficulties with your unyelding spirit. Boosts the holder's Special Attack by 30!
One of the Infinite Crowns. It proves that you overcame difficulties with your abundant wisdom. Boosts the holder's Special Defense by 30!
A mysterious pendant that emits a soft, warm glow. Boosts the holder's Max HP by 50!
It makes the HP of your party members equal the highest HP among you.
Using it sharply boosts the evasiveness of your party on the floor.
User and team go into a Focus Energy status for a short time, raising the critical hit ratio.
Ups Movement Speed of all team members by one level.
Greatly increases the Attack and Special Attack of all teammates on the floor.
Teammates on the floor get the Protect status and are protected from enemy attacks for a set number of turns dependent on the size of the team.
Using it creates the apathetic condition on the floor and makes enemy Pokémon drop any items they may have.
Draws all team members to the user.
Knocks a distant target flying. If the target hits a wall or another Pokémon, it sustains damage.
Sticky, gummed-up items are cleansed of grime, making them usable again
Changes the status of the target to Decoy, making it the target of fellow Pokémon.
It sends a selected item to the Deposit Box.
Drains water and magma from the dungeon floor.
Using it adds 1 notch for an emera to a looplet. But the notch is available only during the adventure.
Using it creates the Enemy Discord condition on the floor and makes enemy Pokémon unable to use an Alliance.
Using it evolves enemy Pokémon in the same room, but it has no effect on your teammates.
Using it devolves enemy Pokémon in the same room, but it has no effect on your teammates.
An escape item that instantly warps the team out of the dungeon.
A stat-boosting item that raises the user's evasiveness by 1 level.
A landfill item that turns any water or lava in the floor into a solid wall.
An item that afflicts all enemies in the room with a Terrified status condition.
An item that afflicts all enemies on the floor with a Petrified status condition
An item that afflicts all enemies in the room with a Paused status condition.
A climate-control item that changes the dungeon floor's weather to a Hail condition.
Using it heals bad status conditions, resets lowered stats of your party, and makes your party healthy. Being healthy prevents bad status conditions or a reduction in stats.
A weapon item that hurls the target toward a random enemy Pokémon to inflict damage.
A sensor item that indicates if the Pokémon on the floor are holding items or not.
An item that gives the user an Invisible status. A Pokémon with the Invisible status is cloaked from view.
A horrifying orb that turns the target Pokemon into an item. If it rebounds you will be turned into an item, so be careful!
Gathers and immobilizes enemy Pokémon in the same room into one place.
A weapon item that inflicts damage on a target up to 2 tiles away.
An item that gives Long Toss status to the user, which makes any item thrown by the user fly until it hits a wall or a Pokémon. It has no effect on thrown rocks.
A mapping item that reveals the entire floor to the user.
An item that gives a Mobile status to the user. A Pokémon with Mobile can move through walls and gullies and walk on lava and water.
Using it changes the room to a Monster House.
A weapon item that inflicts damage on the target, even at a distance. It also steals the target's hold item and makes it the user's. This added affect works only if the user is not holding an item.
Using it nullifies the Abilities of enemy Pokémon on the entire floor.
Changes the status of the target to Paused, making it incapable of action.
A destructive item that tears down all walls on the floor, turning the floor into one vast, open room. This might trigger Monster Houses so be careful!
Lookalike Item for One-Room Orb. Using this will spawn a broom that will sweep away every item from the entire floor!
A weapon item that has a 10% chance of instantly defeating the target in one shot.
An item that afflicts all enemies in the room with a Petrified status condition.
An item that gives Pierce status to the user, which makes any item thrown pierce through walls and all Pokémon it hits without stopping.
If the leader is holding this item and it faints, it will cause an adjacent ally to faint instead, move the leader to its place, and fully restore leader's HP, PP and Belly.
An item that makes the user pounce towards the first Pokémon in its line of sight, no matter how distant. If there are no Pokémon in that direction, the user leaps to the wall.
An item that boosts the Movement Speed of the user and team members in the room by 1 level.
A sensory item that reveals the location of all enemies on the floor.
A climate-control item that changes the dungeon floor's weather to a Rain condition.
An item that changes the user's status to Mini Counter, which enables the user to make certain types of moves and enemy attacks rebound, returning part of the damage
Using it revives all of your fainted teammates.
Functions exactly like a Reviver Seed, but it cannot be accidentally eaten, not even by enemy Pokemon. Phew!
A weapon item that inflicts damage on the target. It also reduces the target's Movement Speed by 1 level.
A warping item that draws all team members to the user.
A climate-control item that changes the dungeon floor's weather to a Sanstorm condition.
A sensory item that reveals the location of all items on the floor.
A sensory item that reveals all hidden traps in the same room as the user.
An item that afflicts a distant target with a Cowering status condition. A Pokémon with the Cowering status will find that its attacks go in the opposite direction on its aim.
An item that afflicts a distant target with a Muzzled status condition. A Pokémon with the Muzzled status is incapable of using moves or items that require the use of its mouth.
A weapon item that inflicts damage on the target. The bigger the target's size, the greater the damage.
A status item that reduces the Movement Speed of all enemies in the room by 1 level.
An item that afflicts all enemies in the room with a Sleep status condition. A Pokémon that has a Sleep status is incapable of action.
An item that gives Snatch status to the user. This status lets the user steal the effects of all moves used by Pokémon on the floor.
An item that warps all enemies in the room to random locations on the floor.
Lookalike item for Spurn Orb. Using this will create a Spin Trap underneath you!
A sensory item that shows the location of the floor's stairway.
An item that afflicts an enemy in the user's line of sight with a Petrified status, then warps it near the floor's stairs.
A climate-control item that changes the dungeon floor's weather to a Sunny condition.
It draws your teammates around the enemy Pokémon in front of you.
An item that makes a distant Pokémon switch places with the user.
Equipping this item forces you to waste a turn to throw it. You can't resist...
An item that afflicts all enemies in the room with a Confused status condition. A Pokémon with the Confused status condition will find that its movements and attacks go astray.
An item that transforms the target into a different Pokémon.
An item that destroys all traps in the room with the user.
An item that sets a trap on the user's tile. The type of trap is randomly determined.
An item that pulls all items on the floor to the user. You can't pull items from a shop though.
An attack item that cuts the HP of all enemies in the room to just 1 HP. But the same will happen to your whole team!
An item that warps a distant Pokémon to a different spot on the floor.

Holding a looplet with this emera restores your HP when you defeat an enemy. Adding multiples of this emera increases the effect. Using this emera as an item slightly increases your HP during the adventure.

Holding a looplet with this emera enables you to take another action right after you defeat an enemy. If you keep defeating enemies with one shot, enemies won't be able to attack! Using this emera as an item slightly boosts your Speed during the adventure.
Holding a looplet with this emera displays the locations of items and Pokémon on the entire floor on the map. Using this emera as an item slightly increases your HP during the adventure.
Holding a looplet with this emera increases the accuracy of moves used in an Alliance. Using this emera as an item slightly boosts your Attack during the adventure.

Holding a looplet with this emera revives teammates right after they faint. But it has no effect unless the leader has it. Also, the leader can't be revived from fainting. Using this emera as an item slightly increases your HP during the adventure.
Holding a looplet with this emera makes you immune to warping or being blown away. Using this emera as an item slightly increases your HP during the adventure.

Holding a looplet with this emera awakens you! If you're capable of Mega Evolution, you'll Mega Evolve; otherwise you'll be awakened. Using this emera as an item slightly increases your HP during the adventure.

Holding a looplet with this emera sometimes enables you to use a move 1 more time. Having more empty notches on a looplet increases the effect. Using this emera as an item slightly boosts your Speed during the adventure.

Holding a looplet with this emera decreases damage little by little when you take multiple attacks in 1 turn. Adding multiples of this emera increases the effect. Using this emera as an item slightly boosts your Sp. Def during the adventure.

Holding a looplet with this emera sometimes prevents stats from being lowered and prevents bad status conditions. Having more varieties of Berries increases the effect. Using this emera as an item slightly boosts your Defense during the adventure.

Holding a looplet with this emera makes a move never miss, and it results in a critical hit if the move's remaining PP is an even number. Using this emera as an item slightly boosts your Attack during the adventure.
Holding a looplet with this emera locates the Pokémon on the floor. Using this emera as an item slightly increases your HP during the adventure.
Holding a looplet with this emera restores more HP when you restore HP via an item, Ability, or move. Using this emera as an item slightly boosts your HP during the adventure.
Holding a looplet with this emera prevents you from having a burn. Using this emera as an item slightly increases your HP during the adventure.
Holding a looplet with this emera locates items on the floor. Using this emera as an item slightly increases your HP during the adventure.

Holding a looplet with this emera makes it easier to dodge attacks in a pinch! Adding multiples of this emera increases the effect. Using this emera as an item slightly boosts your Speed during the adventure.

Holding a looplet with this emera increases the accuracy of a move on your next turn if your move misses. Adding multiples of this emera increases the effect. Using this emera as an item slightly boosts your Sp. Atk during the adventure.
Holding a looplet with this emera prevents you from getting confused. Using the emera as an item slightly increases your HP during the adventure.

Holding a looplet with this emera makes it easier to dodge faraway Pokémon's attacks. Adding multiples of this emera increases the effect. Using this emera as an item slightly boosts your Speed during the adventure.

Holding a looplet with this emera sometimes makes the attacker confused when a move by that attacker damages you. Adding multiples of this emera increases the effect. Using this emera as an item slightly boosts your Sp. Def during the adventure.

Holding a looplet with this emera sometimes makes the target confused when you attack. Adding multiples of this emera increases the effect. Using this emera as an item slightly boosts your Sp. Atk during the adventure.

Holding a looplet with this emera increases the chance that additional effects will be triggered. Adding multiples of this emera increases the effect. Using this emera as an item slightly boosts your Sp. Def during the adventure.

Holding a looplet with this emera sometimes makes enemy Pokémon drop an Elixir when you defeat them. Adding multiples of this emera increases the effect. Using this emera as an item slightly increases your HP during the adventure.

Holding a looplet with this emera sometimes makes enemy Pokémon drop an emera when you defeat them. Adding multiples of this emera increases the effect. Using this emera as an item slightly increases your HP during the adventure.
Holding a looplet with this emera damages nearby enemies with excessive force when you defeat an enemy. Using this emera as an item slightly boosts your Attack during the adventure.
Holding a looplet with this emera reduces damage taken from blasts. Adding multiples of this emera increases the effect. Using this emera as an item slightly boosts your Defense during the adventure.
Holding a looplet with this emera makes your move reach 2 tiles away. Using this emera as an item slightly boosts your Speed during the adventure.

Holding a looplet with this emera boosts all your stats significantly. But be careful! It prevents Tiny Reviver Seeds and similar items from reviving you. Using this emera as an item slightly increases your HP during the adventure.
Holding a looplet with this emera reduces damage from moves. Adding multiples of this emera increases the effect. Using this emera as an item slightly boosts your Defense during the adventure.

Holding a looplet with this emera slows down the Belly's need for food as turns go by. Adding multiples of this emera increases the effect. Using this emera as an item slightly increases your HP during the adventure.
Holding a looplet with this emera enables you to know the number of items on a floor when you move to it. Using this emera as an item slightly increases your HP during the adventure.
Holding a looplet with this emera sometimes makes the target's move fail. Adding multiples of this emera increases the effect. Using this emera as an item slightly boosts your Speed.
This emera will be chosen first when an effect that removes an emera is triggered. Using this emera as an item slightly increases your HP during the adventure.

Holding a looplet with this emera makes the target go to sleep when a move of yours damages it. Adding multiples of this emera increases the effect. Using this emera as an item slightly boosts your Attack during the adventure.

Holding a looplet with this emera boosts your evasiveness until your next turn if your move misses. Adding multiples of this emera increases the effect. Using this emera as an item slightly boosts your Speed during the adventure.

Holding a looplet with this emera enables you to travel through walls, cross hot floors, and so on. But be careful! Your Belly will keep becoming empty while traveling through walls. Using this emera as an item slightly increases your HP during the adventure.
Holding a looplet with this emera speeds up natural HP recovery. Adding multiples of this emera increases the effect. Using this emera as an item slightly increases your HP during the adventure.
Holding a looplet with this emera prevents you from suffering paralysis. Using this emera as an item slightly increases your HP during the adventure.

Holding a looplet with this emera sometimes cuts the attacker's HP to 1 when a move by that attacker damages you. Adding multiples of this emera increases the effect. Using this emera as an item slightly boosts your Sp. Def during the adventure.

Holding a looplet with this emera makes the target become petrified when a move of yours damages it. Adding multiples of this emera or having more sticky items in the Bag increases the effect. Using this emera as an item slightly increases your HP during the adventure.

Holding a looplet with this emera makes your thrown items pierce through all Pokémon and walls and fly endlessly. But it has no effect on thrown stones. Using this emera as an item slightly increases your HP during the adventure.
Holding a looplet with this emera prevents you from getting poisoned or badly poisoned. Using this emera as an item slightly increases your HP during the adventure.

Holding a looplet with this emera boosts the power of moves. Adding multiples of this emera increases the effect. Setting it with a Power Boost Y on a looplet boosts your accuracy as well. Using this emera as an item slightly boosts your Attack during the adventure.

Holding a looplet with this emera boosts the power of moves. Adding multiples of this emera increases the effect. Setting it with a Power Boost X on a looplet boosts your accuracy as well. Using this emera as an item slightly boosts your Sp. Attack during the adventure.

Holding a looplet with this emera restores your PP when you move to the next floor. Adding multiples of this emera increases the effect. Using this emera as an item slightly increases your HP during the adventure.

Holding a looplet with this emera makes the effects of moves and items that give enemy Pokémon a bad status condition last slightly longer. Adding multiples of this emera prolongs the effect. Using this emera as an item slightly boosts your Speed during the adventure.

Holding a looplet with this emera changes the weather on the floor to rain. During this weather, Water-type moves deal more damage and Fire-type moves deal less damage. Using this emera as an item slightly increases your HP during the adventure.
Holding a looplet with this emera prevents all of your stats from being lowered. Using this emera as an item slightly boosts your Sp. Def during the adventure.
Holding a looplet with this emera tells you whether there is a shop or a Monster House when you move to a floor. Using this emera as an item slightly increases your HP during the adventure.
Holding a looplet with this emera prevents the Belly from getting empty as turns go by. Using this emera as an item slightly increases your HP during the adventure.
Not available in-game.

Holding a looplet with this emera prevents you from damaging teammates when you're confused or have the blinker status condition. Using this emera as an item slightly increases your HP during the adventure.
Holding a looplet with this emera prevents you from falling asleep, yawning, or a nightmare. Using this emera as an item slightly increases your HP during the adventure.

Holding a looplet with this emera sometimes makes the attacker sleep when you are damaged by a move. Adding multiples of this emera increases the effect. Using this emera as an item slightly boosts your Defense during the adventure.
Holding a looplet with this emera occasionally prevents you from having a bad status condition. Using this emera as an item slightly boosts your Defense during the adventure.

Holding a looplet with this emera makes the Pokémon in front of you have the same status condition as you when you get one. Using this emera as an item slightly boosts your Speed during the adventure.
Lookalike Item to the Stair Locator Emera. Equipping this to a Looplet will cause the Looplet to become sticky!
Holding a looplet with this emera enables you to see the location of the stairs on the floor. Using this emera as an item slightly increases your HP during the adventure.
Holding a looplet with this emera increases the critical-hit rate when a move is super effective. Using this emera as an item slightly boosts your Attack during the adventure.
Holding a looplet with this emera displays the layout of the floor on the map when you move to a floor. Using this emera as an item slightly increases your HP during the adventure.

Holding a looplet with this emera changes the weather on the floor to sunny. During this weather, Fire-type moves deal more damage and Water-type moves deal less damage. Using this emera as an item slightly increases your HP during the adventure.
Not available in-game.
Holding a looplet with this emera prevents held items from being dropped or stolen. Using this emera as an item slightly boosts your Speed during the adventure.

Holding a looplet with this emera prevents you from waking up sleeping enemy Pokémon when you approach them. It works only for the holder, so be careful. Using this emera as an item slightly increases your HP during the adventure.
Holding a looplet with this emera boosts move growth. Adding multiples of this emera doesn't change the effect. Using this emera as an item slightly boosts your Sp. Atk during the adventure.

Holding a looplet with this emera increases the chance of enemy Pokémon dropping a Treasure Box when you defeat them. Adding multiples of this emera increases the effect. Using this emera as an item slightly increases your HP during the adventure.

Holding a looplet with this emera enables you to dig a hole in the wall by attacking it. But every time you dig, your Belly gets emptier, so take care and watch how much you dig! You can't dig when your Belly is 0. Using this emera as an item slightly boosts your Sp. Atk during the adventure.

Holding a looplet with this emera prevents moves' damage from being reduced when they would not be effective or would have no effect. Using this emera as an item slightly boosts your Attack during the adventure.

Holding a looplet with this emera makes you endure an attack that would cause you to faint. You'll be left with 1 HP remaining, but the emera disappears after you endure an attack. Using this emera as an item slightly boosts your Sp. Def during the adventure.
Holding a looplet with this emera nullifies the effects of traps you step on. Using this emera as an item slightly increases your HP during the adventure.

Holding a looplet with this emera makes the effects of wands spread like a fan. Also, the number of uses remaining sometimes stays the same. Using this emera as an item slightly boosts your Attack during the adventure.

Holding a looplet with this emera sometimes warps the attacker elsewhere when a move by that attacker damages you. Adding multiples of this emera increases this effect. Using this emera as an item slightly boosts your Defense during the adventure.
Holding a looplet with this emera sends the target flying 10 tiles away when you attack by pressing A. Using this emera as an item slightly boosts your Sp. Atk during the adventure.
Raises Attack by 10 and Defense by 7 to all Normal types in your team when kept in the bag
Raises Special Attack by 10 and Special Defense by 7 to all Normal types in your team when kept in the bag
Raises Movement Speed by 1 to all Normal types in your team when kept in the bag
Enemy moves Supereffective to Normal type deal normal damage if there's at least one Pokemon of that type in the team when kept in the bag.
